docs.title: AsyncResult
docs.text:
AsyncResult is a small Kotlin Multiplatform library to model asynchronous operations using a sealed hierarchy. It captures the common states you deal with in UI and data layers:

  • NotStarted
  • Loading
  • Success
  • Error

It also provides convenience helpers for mapping, folding, flow processing, zipping, and error metadata.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
• asyncresult: Core types and utilities.
  • asyncresult-either: Arrow Either extensions.
  • asyncresult-test: assertk helpers for testing.

docs.title: Mapping and folding
docs.text:
val message = result.fold(
    ifNotStarted = { "Waiting" },
    ifLoading = { "Loading..." },
    ifSuccess = { "Hello ${it.name}" },
    ifError = { "Error: ${it.throwable?.message}" },
)

docs.title: Zipping
docs.text:
val combined = zip({ userResult }, { permissionsResult }) { user, permissions ->
    UserWithPermissions(user, permissions)
}

docs.title: Arrow Either extensions
docs.text: The asyncresult-either artifact provides helpers to bridge Arrow's Either with AsyncResult.

docs.title: Bind
docs.text:
val result: AsyncResult<Either<Failure, User>> = Success(userEither)
val unwrapped: AsyncResult<User> = result.bind()

docs.title: Conversion
docs.text:
val either: Either<Failure, User> = eitherValue
val result: AsyncResult<User> = either.toAsyncResult()

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
The asyncresult-test artifact exposes assertk helpers for testing AsyncResult.

import assertk.assertThat
import io.nlopez.asyncresult.test.isSuccessEqualTo

val result: AsyncResult<Int> = Success(42)
assertThat(result).isSuccessEqualTo(42)

Flow helpers are also available:

flow.assertSuccess(42)
